result.execSummary:
The defendant Worthington J Blum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant is prohibited from having any contact whatsoever with the victim  S. Hodge, other than for purposes of discussing issues relating to thier minor child in common.  No contact with T. Hodge unless as required by employment.

Defendant to complete either a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program or an Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  This is solely at the discretion of the Supervising Agent.

timeConds.notes: The 14 days of County Jail are to be served in the following manner and served in three different blocks of time:  Defendant is to report on Friday, December 19, 2014 no later than 6:00 pm and serve four continuous days (12/19/14, 12/20/14, 12/21/14 and 12/22/14) with release by 6:00 AM on 12/22/14.  Defendant is to report again on January 9, 2015 no later than 6:00 pm and serve another four continuous days (1/9/15, 1/10/15, 1/11/15 and 1/12/15) with release by 6:00 AM on 1/12/15.  Finally, Defendant is to report again on January 16, 2015 no later than 6:00 pm and serve the remaining four continuous days (1/16/15, 1/17/15, 1/18/15 and 1/19/15) with release by 6:00 AM on 1/19/15.  Credit for time previously served of 2 days to be applied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case Called @ 1:25 PM: Defendant Worthington J Blum in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA with argued terms of probation.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.   State will move for amendment of Ct 1 to allege Misd Bat Dom - Ct S/W - 2 yrs probation with argued terms of supervision.  Victim present in courtroom and full restitution has been covered by BadgerCare - any claim for Rest will be withdrawn.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's motion to amend Ct 1 to allege Misd Dom Battery contrary to s. 940.19(1) Plea:  NC  Plea Ct 2 DC:   NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Victim makes statement to the Court.  Argument by ADA as to SEH.  Argument by Atty Zamzow as to SEH.  Statement by Def:   None offered.  The Court:  S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Conditions:  No contact with victim other than for purposes of discussing issues relating to their minor child in common; No contact with Tim Hodge unless as required by employment; Complete either DAAP or Anger Mgmt as deemed appropriate by agent - either/or - not both;  As to Ct 1 only: 14 days WCJ imposed and to be served in the following manner and served in 3 separate blocks of time - 1st block 12/19/14, 12/20/14, 12/21/14 and 12/22/2014 - Fri thru Mon and begin serving by no later than 6:00 pm on Friday 12/19/14 and released by 6:00 am on 12/22 (4 days of jail w/credit); 2nd block 1/9/15, 1/10/15, 1/11/15 and 1/12/15 with the same scheduled report time; 3rd block 1/16/15, 1/17/15, 1/18/15 and 1/19/15 with the same report schedule - 12 days with credit for 2 days of time served credit.  Court Costs - 60 DTP plus DNA Surcharge.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:01 p.m. Defendant Worthington J Blum in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. ADA Anderson - the victim is requesting contact regarding the minor child the parties have in common. No objection by Atty Zamzow. The court amends bond to prohibit contact with the victim with the exception of contact via text message regarding the child the parties have in common.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Worthington J Blum in court with attorney Jeanne L Zamzow, both appearing via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  ADA argues as to signature Bond w/no contact provisions.  No objection to bond recommendation of the State.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Sylvia's husband would not be considered a violoation of the no contact provisions - no contact is as to the victim, not her husband.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
